capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've heard that the character Filch in Harry Potter is often portrayed as a bit of a grump. He's always complaining about something and seems to take great pleasure in being mean to the students. But at the same time, I think he's also got a soft spot for certain characters, like Hermione Granger. I mean, despite all his gruff exterior, he does seem to have a bit of a fondness for her.
capsules_submitted.reply: exciting news! i've never heard of filch before, but i'm so excited to learn more about it!

capsules_submitted.utterance: Ron's lineage is indeed quite impressive. As a wizard myself, I can appreciate the importance of having a strong magical heritage. Ron's pure-blood background has certainly served him well in his battles against the Dark Lord.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's an amazing witch and an incredible role model for young witches like myself. Her lineage is indeed pure-blood, and it's no surprise that she went on to become one of the most respected members of the Hogwarts staff.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am glad to have learned something new. i've never heard of mcgonagall before, but i'm so excited to learn more about her!

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's an amazing witch and an incredible role model for young witches like myself. capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have. The mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" has always resonated with me, as it reminds us to respect our students' boundaries and never disturb them when they're sleeping - just like I try to do when I'm lecturing!
